metadata.name: Service StartupType Change Via PowerShell Set-Service
metadata.comment: Detects the use of the PowerShell "Set-Service" cmdlet to change the startup type of a service to "disabled" or "manual"

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\powershell.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('powershell.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('set-service')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-startuptype')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disabled')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('manual'))))

output.summary: Detects the use of the PowerShell "Set-Service" cmdlet to change the startup type of a service to "disabled" or "manual"

metadata.objective: False positive: False positives may occur with troubleshooting scripts Reference: https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/38283b775552da8981452941ea74191aa0d203edd3f61fb2dee7b0aea3514955
